flow.descriptionCdata:
525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.0f5e31c5-08da-46c7-93cb-08f87e098ff0.prompt=VMWare Host\: 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.14c6cffd-2160-4e58-9b2c-d28406682291.prompt=Disk Size (MB\: 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.1726e04c-7026-4f80-84ba-1c27b39ee640.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.17f653f6-fba6-43ae-b601-f429ebfa154b.prompt=Enter a value for corePassword 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.27282510-44c0-4cdd-99c0-7ccce5e4bd92.description=
Retrieve information about a virtual machine or a group of virtual machines in a datacenter or host system (pipe-delimited). Retrieve each object one at a time from an initial search query ala SQL Query operation.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type.
hostSystem - Target virtual machine host system.
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
getDetailed - Retrieve detailed information?

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - there are no more results to retrieve.

Returns\:
vmInfo - Virtual machine information.
numberOfResults - Number of results from the query remaining to be retrieved.
returnResult - Virtual machine ID or operation results.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.4ce9467a-48a1-45b7-a564-984d6db5a5a2.prompt=Enter a value for coreUsername 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.4e32eed4-0070-4571-a85f-0d4f2ef36f8d.prompt=Enter a value for targetHosts 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.501fff3b-74cf-46d3-8e24-de18383cc60e.description=
Sleeps for the number of seconds specified in the input.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for the number of seconds given as input.
failure - Was unable to sleep for some reason.
525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.539d28f9-3647-4614-99be-b97ef3aa8746.prompt=Enter a value for coreUsername 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.5cb6f388-ca22-4512-90cd-d0f4c5dc2dd1.description=
Start a Run Script process using the given parameters on specified list of target servers (Not supported for SA 6.x).

Inputs\:
coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core.
corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on.
coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS.
coreVersion - The core version.
coreUsername - The username for host.
corePassword - The password for host.
scriptToRun - Name of the script to execute.
args - Arguments to pass to the script.
scriptTimeout - Script timeout.
targetHosts - Hosts to execute the scripts on. Should be a ',' seperated list of names or search expressions.
targetUser - Username to execute the scripts as.
targetPassword - Password for the username specified.
targetDomain - Windows domain name (if required).
ticketId - ticketId to associate with job
notificationFailureOwner - sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job fails
notificationSuccessOwner - sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job succeeds
notificationFailureRecipients - a comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job fails
notificationSuccessRecipients - a comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job succeeds

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data

Returns\:
id - The unique ID of this object.
description - The description of this object.
blockedReason - The reason why this job is blocked.
cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled.
endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run.
notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails.
notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes.
notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails.
notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes.
serverName - The name of the server associated with this job.
serverId - The id of the server associated with this job.
staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale.
startDate - The date where this job started.
status - This object's status.
username - This object's user name.
userTag - This object's unique user tag.
525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.6de700e3-683a-4ed7-940f-a5feb7a885ec.description=
Add a new virtual (SCSI) disk to an existing virtual machine.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation (true, false).
async - Asynchronously perform the task (true, false).
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
dataStore - Datastore (eg. host\:dsname, mydatastore).
vmDiskSize - Size of the virtual disk to create in megabytes (MB).
diskPath - Path on datastore to use for backing the new virtual disk. Include .vmdk suffix and do NOT include leading / . This path must not already exist on the datastore.
diskMode - Disk persistence mode. Values for ESX 3 and later VMs\: persistent, independent_persistent, independent_nonpersistent. Valid values for pre ESX 3 VMs\: persistent, nonpersistent, undoable, append.
thinProvision - Perform thin provisioning of the virtual disk (true, false).
diskWritethrough - Enable direct write to the file system (true, false).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task result or operation result.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.70da61be-3a02-4b64-a593-866ad5745ee8.prompt=Datastore\: 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.766ad689-6957-4a46-8530-b0215fa12976.prompt=Enter a value for coreUsername 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.7b65d80d-a689-453d-a798-fa103438539b.prompt=Virtual Machine\: 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.80e992c3-d1be-4105-884d-850fd26f65d8.prompt=VMWare User\: 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.b264ce8c-39a6-4347-aa82-b62df7020733.description=
Sleeps for the number of seconds specified in the input.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for the number of seconds given as input.
failure - Was unable to sleep for some reason.
525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.bdf89441-baf3-4d7d-aff6-b6cbdb811447.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.bf3f8507-d7ae-4a83-980d-b5e67d09fc65.prompt=Password\: 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.c68aa761-e7bc-4ff1-8e0c-5cfb555ba7ed.prompt=Enter a value for corePassword 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.cfb2073e-851c-4cce-a950-450055e7d0e0.description=
Start a Run Script process using the given parameters on specified list of target servers (Not supported for SA 6.x).

Inputs\:
coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core.
corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on.
coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS.
coreVersion - The core version.
coreUsername - The username for host.
corePassword - The password for host.
scriptToRun - Name of the script to execute.
args - Arguments to pass to the script.
scriptTimeout - Script timeout.
targetHosts - Hosts to execute the scripts on. Should be a ',' seperated list of names or search expressions.
targetUser - Username to execute the scripts as.
targetPassword - Password for the username specified.
targetDomain - Windows domain name (if required).
ticketId - ticketId to associate with job
notificationFailureOwner - sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job fails
notificationSuccessOwner - sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job succeeds
notificationFailureRecipients - a comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job fails
notificationSuccessRecipients - a comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job succeeds

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data

Returns\:
id - The unique ID of this object.
description - The description of this object.
blockedReason - The reason why this job is blocked.
cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled.
endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run.
notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails.
notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes.
notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails.
notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes.
serverName - The name of the server associated with this job.
serverId - The id of the server associated with this job.
staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale.
startDate - The date where this job started.
status - This object's status.
username - This object's user name.
userTag - This object's unique user tag.
525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.d2652ead-d613-4d9b-bc72-22e0eab7f70c.prompt=Datacenter to create in\: 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.d8be6061-229d-440a-a6da-2d1d7298078d.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.dc2cfdbc-78db-4abd-8cfa-d75a7785957d.prompt=Enter a value for targetHosts 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.description=
Add a new partition/disk to the server

Inputs

 VMID - the unique Identifier of the VM on a vCenter.
 host -  vCenter host to execute against
 port - Port Number toconnect on
 protocol - Connection prtocol(http, https)
 user - vCenter username
 password - vCenter password
 vmDatacenter -  target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VM
 hostSystem - current ESX host for the VM
 dataStore -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 disksize - Additional Disk size other than the boot disk.. A new disk space will be allocated as a new partition.
 SAhost - Core Host
 SApassword - Core Password
 SAprotocol - Core Protocol
 SAusername - Core Username
 vmMode - Disk persistence mode. Values for ESX 3 and later VMs\: persistent, independent_persistent, independent_nonpersistent. Valid values for pre ESX 3 VMs\: persistent, 
	 nonpersistent, undoable, append.
 thinProvision - Perform thin provisioning of the virtual disk (true, false).
 toEmail		\: Email Recepient
 fromEmail		\: From Email 
 smtpHost		\: Smtp Host
 smtpPort		\: Smtp Port
 smtpHostUser	\: Smtp Uer
 smtpHostPassword	\: Smtp Password

 Note \: Currently, CSA 3.0 is not using this flow.

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.ea37586a-2aaf-4198-a75f-122181db2190.prompt=Enter a value for corePassword 525ee8dc-4b2f-44d3-9002-144f40c2eeba.fa508d64-8bd2-4b93-86e2-cf0fb26175b1.description=Retrieves the id and name of the object having the provided type and matching the given search expression. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. type - The searchable type. It can be obtained using the operation Get Searchable Types. filter - The search expression. It can be built using the attributes retrieved by the Get Searchable Attributes operation. If this input is not provided, then all the objects of the given type will be returned. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: id - The entity id. name - The entity name.
flow.name: vCenter Expand Disk

staticBinding.value: Unable to Expand or Add Disk space for Id:${id}
Error Occured! Unable to Add Disk space
